abstract: Gannett reports a severe decline in advertising revenue, pointing to a pullback in consumer and business spending; shares fall 8.7 percent as company reports earnings of 41 cents a share, compared with 42 cents in the year-earlier period; total newspaper advertising revenue fell 8.5 percent, to $591.7 million; total revenue fell 3.5 percent, to $1.27 billion.
snippet: Newspaper advertising declined severely, pointing to a pullback in consumer and business spending, but the company met Wall Street profit and revenue expectations.
lead_paragraph: Newspaper advertising declined severely, pointing to a pullback in consumer and business spending, but the company met Wall Street profit and revenue expectations.

headline.main: Profit and Ad Revenue Fall at Gannett
headline.print_headline: Profit and Ad Revenue Fall at Gannett
